title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon City)
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasts for 30 minutes, and there are 3 interviewers. The interviewers are nice, both cantonese and english questions are including in the interview, and usually ask about problem solving question.
Interview Questions: please talk about something yourself. can you talk the biggest difficulty you have faced?

title: Undergraduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: There would be a 45 minute written test (format unknown) with a 10 minute individual interview. As I am a student applying for changing the major, my experience may not be the same as the others.
Interview Questions: Why would you choose to apply for Translation?

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Sha Tin) in Jul 2023
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviewers asking about why you want to have the job and provide some scene for you to react Provided detail explanation on the job nature and what possible opportunities
Interview Questions: Why would you like the job

title: Executive Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong)
Interview Descriptions: First interview, written test with four to five questions in English and Chinese, then panel interview with five interviewers from the Faculty/ Department. Shortlised candidates will have second interview with the direct report supervisor.
Interview Questions: Scenario question on handling complicated task.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: The written test was easy. There was a 10-20 mins interview after the 1-hour written test. It seemed that many people applied for this job. No response after the interview.
Interview Questions: Why apply for this job

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: good experience. the process is great. nothing to complain about recommended to the others. Welcome to join. the process took a day, very simple question. quick follow up after the interview
Interview Questions: - why u wanna join the team

title: Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: 1hour written test with four questions, in Chinese and English. The task is not so hard and ask about planning an event. 30mins face to face interview, asked in Mandarin and English.
Interview Questions: What is your career path you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: This is a relatively easy interview process. Besides of some math and stat problem, interviewers ask you why you want to enter this position. and something else about your resume
Interview Questions: why do you choose us

title: Undergraduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview for biomedical engineering , but each of us were asked the same questions and answered one after another. The group consisted of 6 people, and there were 2 interviewers
Interview Questions: What are your future career plans? Why did you choose (first choice cource) over biomedical engineering?

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: Just present your talent that shows you are suitable for the job. And be passionate so the employees can see you are ready to engage in work. Also. You have to mention some past experiences that shows your ability to resolve problems independently.
Interview Questions: What do you think the most difficult part when you worked with other?

title: Executive Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview by a panel consist of 2 representatives form the user department, a representative from a partnering department, and HR, followed by written test consists of three questions, in either Chinese or English.
Interview Questions: To create a work plan on certain project

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: It was conducted few months ago and was a smooth experience. However, the advertisement did not mention all of the requirement. Seems that the job requirement is much more than the advertisement stated.
Interview Questions: Self-introduction and job specific was asked. The job was responsible to teach some master degree students.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: 15-minute face-to-face interview in English and Chinese, also need to take a written test (English). The interview seems to be more important than the written test. It is highly competitive.
Interview Questions: why do you apply for this position

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: Started with a quick introduction about yourself. Asked a couple of questions about my previous job. Then the professor asked why would you interested in this job. The entire interview process is about 10 min.
Interview Questions: what was a daily life looks like when u were doing your previous job

title: Project Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Ride school bus 1A in exit C of University station. Mostly in English and some in Mandarin. Six interviewees in a row. Three interviewers include the head of department. Around 15 mins.
Interview Questions: Any related experience? What's your expected salary?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Received a call about one week after applying online. Very relaxed online interview, more like a chat to get to know me and introduce their project, than an interview. The three interviewers were all very nice. Was also invited to visit their office to know more about the project.
Interview Questions:
Introduce your background and relevant experiences.
How's your Chinese language ability?
Expected salary

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: The interview was highly academic oriented as you are expected to investigate different topics with various faculties. So be prepared and act like an expert on your respective topics. Good luck.
Interview Questions: What are the languages you would be able to speak.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: A professor and a lecturer interview, some questions about teaching job, such as python programming. For example, what is the difference between list and tuple, how to read CSV file, and what is the difference between deep copy and shallow copy, and so on.
Interview Questions: what is the difference between list and tuple, how to read CSV file, and what is the difference between deep copy and shallow copy, and so on.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: Overall atmosphere is good. Briefly introduced former experience and project worked on, and asked for details. Asked for the publications and what i have reviewed. Explained why choose this position and expectation for future.
Interview Questions: Former experience, project and expectation for future.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions:
Received the notification around 2weeks after the AD deadline. 
Need to take the Written Test & the Interview. The interview is arranged right after the written test, on the same day.
Interview Questions:
1. self-introduction
2. Why you applied for this position

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Comfortable, Good conversation, the work address is too far need enough time to arrive. The interviewer was very nice and the results were clear, with no delays.Both Chinese and English interviews are available
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself and display own works.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions:
Complete a written test and attend an interview. May then be invited to another round of interview afterwards. 

Interviews conducted in Cantonese, English and Mandarin composing of different questions related to your experience.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself and asked about personal working experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer are nice and will help direct the conversation. Unless you have a specific skill set, they prefer fresh people they are willing to learn. For junior post, you just need to know the research area, it’s ok if you don’t have the knowledge.
Interview Questions: Share the skills, or technique you used (eg RT-PCR) during your last job.

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions:
Interview with 2 or 3 interviewers, around 30 to 40 minutes.

Written Test which including how to write a public speech, formal letters, announcement, formal e-mail etc in both Chinese and English
Interview Questions: Self introduce, past working experience, expectation of the position

title: Project Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
It took three interviews for me to get an offer for this role. For the first round, the HR team asks you to introduce yourself in 1 min, share an experience that you encounter with challenge, and one more. 
For the second round, I ad the interview with the faculty board, it is a more thorough interview with asking you what is your knowledge with the faculty and asking in three different languages.
Interview Questions:
It took three interviews for me to get an offer for this role. For the first round, the HR team asks you to introduce yourself in 1 min, share an experience that you encounter with challenge, and one more. 
For the second round, I ad the interview with the faculty board, it is a more thorough interview with asking you what is your knowledge with the faculty and asking in three different languages.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Received the call two days later and the interview was scheduled a week after that. It was a face to face interview. Interviewed with two professors. They were friendly and explained the job duties clearly.
Interview Questions:
Self introduction 
Why do you want to leave your current  job

title: General Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Sha Tin) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: 1 to 2 hours Written Test (Mainly English Test) 15 to 30 minutes Interview (May have 1st and 2nd round interview) Wait for few days to have the notification from the department
Interview Questions: Working Experience in the related duties

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: interview is online through zoom, which is face to face with the professor and the group. Self introduction and discuss the previous research and related experiences, also discuss the current work of the group.
Interview Questions: What is your previous work

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Meeting with supervisor, introduce education background, introduce research background, introduce future research plan, talk about you career plan, talk about why choosing CUHK and what can you do to contribute to the development of CUHK and Hong Kong or broader society
Interview Questions: Why do you wanna do phd

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: The first is a Self intro around 3 mins,  3 interviewers ask questions, including one hr staff, one program head, and one dept head, easy to answer, not difficult to finish
Interview Questions: Which modules did you teach before?

title: Assistant Computer Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions:
Online application in CUHK website
Call to schedule interview around 2 weeks later
Total 3 people on the board, 2 Senior and 1 Team Head in Middle
Get an offer after 1 month after the interview
Schedule the start working day
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself,  why are you leaving, ask technical questions about yourself, logical questions about troubleshooting, ask something new you do not learn, chitchat

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: The interview starts  with Word Typing in English .Interview with 2 interviewers, self intro, personal background and introduction of postWhole process lasts for 20minutes and the overall is fine and pleasant.
Interview Questions: What are you unforgettable experience in your college’s study?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: interview of the sports project was easy and they give me the email offer. but they do not offer contract after nearly 3 months. and they haven't decline or confirm yet. they will reply the email but the delay is really irresponsible.
Interview Questions: do you know how to read documents and materials

title: Safety Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions:
General admin process for academic and working experience certificate confirmation
30 minutes face to face interview with three interviewers
No written test 
Asking about the current role and responsibility and how would you handle the difficulties in different scenario.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself with academic and working experience

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions:
good 
zoom interview and then face to face and then written test 
chill and friendly 
chinese and english questions
lasted for twenty minutes 
great experience 
need to prepare cv and letter and expected salary those stuff lah add oil
Interview Questions: why do u want to apply

title: General Clerk II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: 1.5 hour computer test, reply complaint email, excel plot graph, word mail merge. Followed by interview X 2.
Interview Questions: Common questions, why leave current job, talked about past job experiences

title: PA II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds, 1st round with written test: essay and excel, simple interview for 20-30 mins, 2nd round zoom in with professors, nice chat, immediate result announcement 30 mins after 2nd in
Interview Questions: Why did you quit your last job?

title: Junior Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: I applied the job online. Then I received an invitation email to the Zoom interview after 1 week. After a 15 minutes interview, I received the offer in one month.
Interview Questions: Why you  apply this job?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: We started a few minutes earlier since everyone arrived at Zoom early. The interviewers were the professors from the Department and we knew one another so it was more like a friendly conversation than an interview. They introduced what project they were onto and asked me if I had the required skills.
Interview Questions: Please introduce yourself in English.

title: Assistant Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: 2 face-to-face interviews and 2 cases. About one whole month but end up with hiring another experienced editor even though the job ad said it would be an entry level job.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself. Why editor. How to promote books.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions:
1 written test with proofreading and a proposal recommendation
then headed to the interview directly by asking how you think you are suitable for this job position
the panel was nice overall speaking they tend to drill on your past working experience to see whether you can fit in with the ideal candidate type
Interview Questions: Why you are suitable?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview and it started with a Self-introduction. A class teaching demonstration session was required. A topic was given for preparation. Then, it ended with individual panelists meeting me individually.
Interview Questions: Why are you suitable for this job?

title: Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview , written test , second interview with external panel, human resource office call for salary check and supporting document , offer check , written employment contract , sign duplicate and submit within 14 days
Interview Questions: Strength and weakness

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: the interview process is in english, we have to face with 3 interviewer. And all the interview questions just to test your ability and attutide when faced with pressure and to deal with some urgent case
Interview Questions: How do you face problem

title: Project Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: First round interview, maybe online one due to covid, sometimes with written test and computer skills test. Usually they will invite you to do a 2nd round interview before hiring you.
Interview Questions:
Why do you change your career from another industry to education industry?
How your past working experience contribute to this role?

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: 20 minutes of interview. Asking you to introduce yourself. will set up some situation to see how you react. 30 minutes of written test. doing an apt test to see your personality
Interview Questions: Asking you to introduce yourself. will set up some situation to see how you react.

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: Send a CV and a personal statement to the professor who is recruiting student research assistants. A writing sample or an interview may be required. Usually will receive the result within a month.
Interview Questions: Send CV and a personal statement to the professor.

title: Junior Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: The interview was around 15 minutes. The interviewers were 2 professors and 1 nurse. They fist asked about some general questions and would like to know more about yourself. Then, they asked a few technical questions about research procedure and SPSS.
Interview Questions: What is your career path?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions:
Sincere and well organized interviewing process; first time on video interview and interviewer's set up was appropriate but audio quality with echo was a little challenging.
Very straight forward questions, particularly focus to learn about the background  and drivers to work in educational institution
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join education sector from your current industry background ?

title: Junior Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Sha Tin) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Professor interviewed me and told me her concerns. Brought me to visit the laboratory and the environment, as well as chatting to current lab members to know more about their daily jobs and advices.
Interview Questions: What will be your career plan?

title: Student Helper Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Firstly, the interviewer asked about your past experience, such as the projects that you have done, then ask some UI problems. For example, what is the problem of the UI and how to fix the UI of the website.
Interview Questions: How technology do you use in this project?

title: Computer Technician II - Applications Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions:
One Online Written Test, Two Online Interviews

For the former, need you to write code to generate given output, and design classes for given situation.
For the latter, research student and professors ask you list of questions.  They ask your past, what is your strength, and so on. Also, need you to answer the output by given code in real time.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself

title: Computer Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions:
Self intro and then Q and A
Ask what you learn before
3-5 question about programing and some data structure (c++ and java)
pros and cons of data structure
Around 10 mins
2 interviewers (2 professor)
Interview Questions: pros and cons of data structure

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: It is better you prepare your portfolio and resume and have basic knowledge of your professor's study. A fresh graduate is welcome. do not shy to communicate your professor for the job
Interview Questions: what is your career plan

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: 15 mins, through zoom. A professor and a PhD student. The process is quick, and I don't think I tive a good answer. The PhD studuent ask the most questions.
Interview Questions: Machine Learning

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Unlike most reviews here, there were actually two rounds for me. Interviewers were nice and most questions were behavioural with a few technical questions. Make sure you have some relevant experiences i.e. projects completed during studies, or work, to talk about. 

Overall the interview process was smooth and not too much pressure. After the first interview, which was 1 to 1, I received an invitation to my second interview one day later with the director, associate director and HR. The second interview was conducted 4 days later and consisted of more behavioural questions and was mostly an eligibility check and for you to know more about their department/team.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your master's course

What are your career aspirations?

Tell me what you know about us

What was your reason for working in Hong Kong?

How would you recommend a Statistical model with (not good nor bad) 80% accuracy to your manager that it is acceptable to use?

How do you assign a label to a new unknown data point?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: I was called to be interviewed after applying on the university's online portal. It was three weeks before they responded with an email (also close to the unposting date of the vacancy) One round with two of the senior research assistants.
Interview Questions: How would one conduct a medical research with concerns on ethnics of population confidentiality and the incremental biases?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Introduced my past research experiences, strengths,  Interviewer introduced their research projects and their expectations of me in the team. The process was not difficult. The interviewers were nice. I learned more from their introduction but could have asked more for the details of the post.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are fit for the post

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon City) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Interview: ask for pass work exp.
After interviewing, the HRO will assign a seat to you and start the written test.
Written test (60mins): draft guidelines on the notice of bad weather. Translation
Interview Questions: pass exp

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: Gave a talk about previous research work in front of the intended group, just like normal presentations that a phd student usually did. And then Q&A and open discussion on potential research projects.
Interview Questions: What did you do in your phd?

title: RAS Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Sha Tin) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a multi-stage process for hiring new employees. The interview process typically includes the following steps: writing a job description, posting a job, scheduling interviews, conducting preliminary interviews, conducting in-person interviews, following up with candidates and making a hire.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: submit application with reference letter and description of my work. First your application will go through the admin but you also need to contact the professor to ensure he is happy to hire you.
Interview Questions: Why here, why me

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions:
It really depends who will employ you for the position.
In my case, the supervisor is nice and the interview is not intensive.
As long as you have previous projects that demonstrate your capabilities, the supervisor will hire you.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous projects

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Fill in application form
Then have written test
Then have board interview
Final interview
Then background check
At least the university will send me the offer letter
Then i accept the offer letter
Then i wait for around 1 month to get on board
Interview Questions: Why do you leave your current job

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: Presentation followed by individual interviews by individual professor. The presentation was around 1 hour with your work, future vision, and teaching plan. The individual interview focuses on what you can bring to the table and what is your budget plan.
Interview Questions: Why Hong Kong?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: Some Professors, from the department of ee. only one interviewee. The environment is ok, not so much pressure. everything just went through smoothly. 30 words? I really do not know how to say that much.
Interview Questions: My education background, and research experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and had a Skype interview as I am not working in Hong Kong.  after submitting the application it was long enough (at least a month) for me to forget I have applied for this job before their invitation.

Tips: It is extremely important that you have searched the department/institution background before the interview
Interview Questions: What post are you applying

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The boss will ask you to send your CV to him/ her. And talk about the scientific experience you underwent.   If the boss knows that you can contribute to his program, he/she will accept you.
Interview Questions: What was the scientific focus when you were a master?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I have applied online for the online job application system. After waiting for 1 week, I have received a phone call regarding the interview. The interview was done by a face-to-face bases.
Interview Questions: Tell us 3 strengths about you

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Sha Tin) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview. There were 2 interviewers. The face-to-face interview was quite normal but the skill tests were very difficult.  Interviewers had to write 2 essays and attend typing test in 2 hours.
Interview Questions: Please introduce yourself

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Sha Tin) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Checked my education background and experience based on my CV first, then described the job content for reference, followed by a few questions about my relevant skills, publications and knowledge on this field.
Interview Questions: How do you think of this job?

title: Junior Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by the PI. It was quite relaxing and they asked you about your background and related experience. Not harsh at all. But I think it really depends on who interviews you.
Interview Questions: education background, previous work experience, future plan, etc..

title: Student Helper Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: not idea about the interview process, you just have to apply for the job online and then the staff will call u. Perhaps she may ask you some simple questions for the background check. Anyway, there is nothing to worry regarding the interview process. U can get it anyway.
Interview Questions: why do you want to be a student helper

title: GlobalProgram Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions:
It is a group interview, 8-10 people in the room, 2 examiners
1. everyone introduces himself / herself
2. group discussion
3. everyone dicusses and gives opinion on the topics, on average you can speak twice in the discussion
Interview Questions: how do you think we can improve IT industry at Hong Kong?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I searched online for opportunites and sent emails.
Respondses were received a week later and interview was arranaged.
Before the interview, aptitude test should be conducted.
During the interview, the interviewer  asked about research backgrounds, research plan and career plan.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Mainly technical questions from the professor and mainly on the research work you did previous, such the research method, skills required and what expectation of future project, research idea, funding procedure and any career development in academic or other potential possibility.
Interview Questions: What is your research project?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions: There is a written test about the research topic, including the methodology. A test with the use of Excel is required. Constructing chart is necessary. Then face-to-face interview with 2 professors.
Interview Questions: Why do you apply?

title: Part Time Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong)
Interview Descriptions: Some discussion about your former experience, especially your computer competency, and check your time availability. But the questions are simple. And later a written test was given. It's a extremely easy test tests your computer ability
Interview Questions: Did you have any programming experience. How good is your word. How many time do you have per week

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Sha Tin) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Face-to-face interview with professor who posts position for recruiting PDF.  Did the presentation to introduce research background and answer questions asked by professor. Then professor showed me around his laboratory and discussed with me for what he plans to investigate when I join his team.
Interview Questions: Previous research experiences, publication records, communication skills and research plans.

title: Junior Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Ma Liu Shui) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process took about a week; I applied online, then three days later the Dept called me for scheduling an interview a few days later. I completed a written test and then was interviewed by a panel for 15 minutes.
Interview Questions: Self-introduction, what is your goal in future, describe your thesis, why would you apply the job, do you acquire certain skills...

title: Junior Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: One round interview with a panel of three people (Two professors and the Lab Manager). They were very kind, just asked questions about my background and my previous lab experience and if I have used a PCR before. This was probably because it was my first real job after university.
Interview Questions: Tell us a bit about your lab experience at university.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong
Interview Descriptions:
Firstly, I did self-introduction. Then we chatted about the skills and experiences I have regarding the job.
After that, interviewer described of the job nature, and make sure I will be able to work with the job duties.
Interview Questions: After describing the job nature, interviewer asked, 'do you think I can help you doing this job?'.

title: PhD Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
A one-round interview facing 10 panel members from the faculty.
The interview focuses on your research interests, achievements and past experience on doing research.
It takes about half an hour, not difficult at all.
Just present your true self and it will be fine.
Interview Questions: Why do you choose CUHK?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by 4 professors in the department. I was asked to introduce myself first and then described previous experience from bachelor level to current situation. Mainly asked by one professor, and others professors occasionally complemented their questions.
Interview Questions: asked about previous experience in detail, the reason for choosing a technician position

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted job application by post, take 2 days to receive invitation for interview.
They made a phone call in the morning asking me to go to the department for interview.

The interview lasted for 30 minutes, with two interviewers. (The department head and the team supervisor.) The interview was conducted in English and Chinese.

Asked simple questions like- introduce yourself, describe a research project your participated, what is your career plan, research interest.

More questions emphasise on skills and personality- to make sure you can work with team.

Receive offer 2 days after interview, and report to duty in 2 weeks- quick and smooth process.
Interview Questions: 'We have no interest and no plan on your interested research topic, what do you think about that?'

title: Junior Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was a casual interview with the supervisor and a post-doc of the lab in a conference room. Language was in English or Cantonese. Questions in various aspect were asked including previous job and future job prospects.
Interview Questions: What was your previous job function?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Generally speaking, it is pretty east to make through if well-prepared. My comment would be be confident, do the research you need and also go take a walk in CUHK campus and make sure whether here really fits you. Were it not for the time clash of my class, I would have accepted this job. Besides, you will need to go through all of the typical question of the interview such as what is your weakness and so on. Make sure you are influential in Cantonese since it would be better for you to communicate with the professor.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience of being a Teaching Assistant

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
There are a total of  2 rounds of interview.  I waited for 1 monthf or the first round and another month for the 2nd round
 first round with my immediate supervisors and second round with the chairman of the department.   The panel is made up of 3 people, 1 HR 2 professors, they are friendly and trying to get to know you more.
Interview Questions:
why do you want to work here
why do you think we should hire you
What do you see yourself in 5 years

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Meets more than 6 professors and they asked what I know about in the field and why you would like to study PhD. The process is easy and they are all nice guys.
Interview Questions: Why would you study this PhD?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview is in English and Cantonese. A self-introduction comes first, and the interviewer will ask  of past experiences and expectations of the new job. Then the panel make some follow-up questions on what you have mentioned. Finally they have arranged the interviewees to make a writing test to access the writing ability.
Interview Questions: How can you adapt to the working environment that over 90% of the employees are women?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The first round Interview is in the annual INFORMS meeting. You need to answer questions to about your research to persuade them that your research background matches their requirement. The on-campus interview is a one-day interview. In each 30 minutes, you need to talk with two faculty members about your research and teaching interests. The most important part is the research seminar. It is about one and a half hours. Most faculties and students will attend the seminar.
Interview Questions: What is the motivation of the you research?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: The written and oral examination are needed. Sometime the early application is available and it depends on the different departments. Long-time preparation is not needed. The test is average. You should be open minded.
Interview Questions:
What's the challenge in your last project?
Why do you choose CUHK?

title: Full-time Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Chinese University of Hong Kong (Hong Kong) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: One face-face interview
Interview Questions: N/A
